page.title: 06SOCIAL CENTRES OF FAIRFORD
page.content: {Palmer Hall}in London Street is a single room village hall. Built in l937 to commemorate the Coronation of George VI, it was given by Col. Palmer, the biscuit magnate who was the last tenant Squire of the Manor. The social life of the town still centres on the Hall for wedding receptions, meetings, polling, clinics, dances, plays, bazaars and badminton. The move of Farmor's School to new buildings in the Park in l96l released the old school, in the High Street for use by the Youth Club. Dedicated as a{Community Centre}in l977 as the town's Silver Jubilee project, the Centre accommodates the Youth Club, Playgroup, citizens and Volunteer Bureaux; gardening, art, bee-keeping, keep-fit, Young Farmers, Judo, and senior citizens club meetings, and a county library branch.
